Author: CrisF#3405
Content: @Stephen Daniels Hi, are you thinking data like price feeds, GPS data, streaming data (video for example) etc?

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Put on-chain through an oracle? Then used by other contracts?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @Stephen Daniels oracles CC allows to put offchain data onchain

Author: Stephen Daniels#2943
Content: is the system that collects and filters the accuracy of the date decentrlized?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it depends on whatever is implemented

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: usually an oracle is trusted to provide accurate data, hence its name "oracle"

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: oracles CC is a mechanism for getting offchain data onchain

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but garbage in/garbage out still applies

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if you put garbage data onchain, it is onchain, but still garbage

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: jl777, I've got a question in regards to dPoW. Do the NN run their own full node for each chain being notarized? and if so do they create the hash based on their own Nodes information?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: They run full native node

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: notaries run a normal node to get the blockhash, all notaries participate in a randomized process to get consensus on the blockhash, then all the nodes in the network validate it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: to call NN as centralized is like saying that when you send out a tx, it is centralized because only you were involved in creating the tx. it is a nonsensical point of view

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the decentralization comes from all the nodes validating

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: regardless of how many nodes were involved in creating the tx

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: out of intrest what is the maximum amount of nodes who can participate... i.e minsigs?

Author: jusoaresf#3291
Content: Or a router... if tx goes through a router... is it centralized?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: practically speaking minsigs over 18 has a hard time reaching consensus, but it can be set to some crazy high number like 50 and you wont ever get a consensus
